recent_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
recent_posts.summary:
- Two papers criticized for incorrect assumptions about Bitcoin's security model.
- Assumption of trustless out-of-band payments through oracles or altchains deemed unrealistic.
- Maintaining nash equilibrium between miners crucial for Bitcoin's security; LN-like protocols can help prevent attacks.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains without the server's knowledge.
- Blinded statechains rely on trusting the server to report the number of partial signatures.
- The musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation to generate the final signature.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark is a new second-layer protocol design alternative to the Lightning network.
- It uses virtual UTXOs (vTXOs) to enable off-chain payments without liquidity constraints.
- The protocol is facilitated by an untrusted intermediary called the Ark Service Provider (ASP).

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets can be lost or compromised, making addresses generated from them toxic data.
- Silent Payments solve this by allowing multiple payments to a single address without privacy concerns.
- Adding an expiration date to Silent Payment addresses prevents harmful mistakes and ensures usability.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We will conduct a "dry run" to validate local reputation algorithms using real-world data.
- The plan includes collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing algorithms.
- We prioritize privacy, encourage node operators to participate, and provide more details in the email.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network offer privacy but limit payment options.
- Routing payments through regulated hubs may harm decentralization and compromise privacy.
- Concerns raised about pressure to adopt this approach to prevent receiving OFAC coins.
